item.description:
Join us Tuesday, May 18th, 7pm at the Marliave in Boston for a night of junk-y revelation as U35 hosts its inaugural poetry reading with two of Boston's most promising young writers, James Stotts and Janaka Stucky.

James Stotts' new book Since (O'er Books) follows the hermetic reversal of his baby boy, the fleet-footed flightless rescue from death-before-life to his first trials with alienation. Also, he bastardizes the Russian masters and makes friends with powerful political families on the Atlantic Coast and the Asian sub-continent, sympathizes with the terrorists and falls in love with auto-medications. His poems and translations have been published in 1913, Little Star, AGNI, and cetera.

Janaka Stucky won The Boston Phoenix poll as Boston's Best Poet, 2010: he 'has lived with junkies, been killed onstage as his Black Cat Burlesque alter-ego J. Cannibal, is a zombie fanatic, founder and managing editor of Black Ocean press, the head of the magazine Handsome, a part-time undertaker, and a poet. Brave Men Press recently put out his chapbook, Your Name Is the Only Freedom. He likes “his whiskey neat and his music dirty,” [as does James Stotts, for the record] and his poems are lovely — pre-mortem glances at mortality and connection.

[These are two brilliant writers. -- ZB]
item.name: First session of the U35 Reading Series, w/James Stotts and Janaka Stucky.
